reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an excellent night of sleep for this best western, located on Hwy 97, close to the airport. they will even pay for cabfare from the airport if you ask.
reviews.title: comfortable room, great service

reviews.text: Will stay there again when we return.
reviews.title: Ditto on be extremely careful About eating their continental Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both of us got a case of intestinal cramps hours after eating nothing but the breakfast
reviews.title: Felt like Family
Good Value -Nice Rooms
reviews.text: Muffins / gravy
Raisin toast
reviews.title: Best of the Best Westerns!!!

reviews.text: Pleasant hotel of its kind. Rooms were more spacious and better decorated than we expected, and the bed and bed linens and bathroom were equivalent to hotels a notch or two above this. Full breakfast was self-serve and institutional, but generous and mostly fine - biscuits and gravy were awful. Hallways leading from reception to stairways and rooms give the place an unfortunate locker room feel. Staff were cordial. Rate was extremely good. Located near many restauarants and stores and near main highway. I would recommend.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and good service, especially at the price.

reviews.text: Remodeled, modern, nice rooms, clean, friendly staff, nice breakfast room. An enjoyable stay. Yes, I would stay here again when next in Redmond.
reviews.title: Nicely done.

reviews.text: We had ridden several hours on motorcycles for a bike rally in Prineville. When we walked in to register we must have looked a bit windswept because the lady at the front desk took 2 steps back like we frightened her, she quickly gave us our room key and never mentioned they served breakfast each morning. The breakfast has muffins, fruit, cereal, eggs and bisquits w/gravy. There was no bacon, sausage available. We found out about breakfast when we went downstairs later and we asked the gentleman behind the desk for the evening shift about it. The man who works the desk on the evening shift wasn't properly dressed all 3 days we were there, wore the same shirt and it was not ironed, very wrinkled so I'm surprised he wasn't sent home and asked to change into proper attire. As the evening progressed I came downstairs several times to find him smoking cigarettes out in the front of the hotel, not real professional for a Best Western in my opinion. We stayed for 3 nights, hotel was full but very quiet. The room is a bit dated, decor doesn't match well but is comfortable. Another thing that stood out regarding this hotel not being up to BW standards is the front of the hotel hasn't been maintained well. There are 2 bowed benches in front for customers to sit on and they are about to fall apart, the trash can wasn't emptied the whole time we stayed there and it was filled to the top, garbage overflowing and was attracting bees and flies. The hotel keeps the front door wide open and I noticed a bee flying around the lobby. There were some flowers in several pots but they hadn't been manicured or watered for a very long time, the dirt was cracked it was so dry. When we returned to the hotel each day I noticed the bath tub had not been washed out nor had an empty bottle of shampoo been removed from the tub caddy. We also found a empty tampon wrapper in the bathroom trash can on the day we checked in. I think they can do much better than this, we stay at BW a lot and this one is below standard.
reviews.title: Not up to Best Western standards

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for the pool and because it had a good rating on Tripadvisor. The pool was fantastic for my 7 year old granddaughter. The beds were wonderful. As good as the Hilton or Marriott and the breakfast was great. Biscuits, sausage gravy, scrambled eggs, waffles, muffins, bagels, fresh fruit, etc. I usually stay in a higher end place and was quite pleased with this stay. Staff was very pleasant and the room comfortable and quiet. Good sleep at a good price. This hotel should be #1 on Tripadvisor for Redmond, as I can't imagine a better place for the money.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations/Heavenly beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay in or near Bend, Oregon for a last minute road trip. We settled on this hotel after reading previous reviews on TripAdvisor. It's right by Highway 97, but we didn't hear any traffic noise as our room was as far from the highway as could be and we had the room's air system running pretty much the whole time we were there.
reviews.title: Great base in the Bend area

reviews.text: This hotel was clean, bathroom and room was very clean, the hotel was well maintained, felt safe with kids, breakfast was wonderful and felt like home and staff was awesome. I would stay here again and again. I would recommend this hotel to everyone going through central oregon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Exceeded all Expectations

reviews.text: Check in was quick and pleasant, I was asked if I would be needing the WiFi password which I did and was told the closing time for the pool as well as the time for the continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: Getting to our room was a bit awkward, the entrance we used was literally at the end of the hotel. Once we knew where the door was it wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Clean - Good Service - good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a 2 story hotel and the room doors are on the interior, it was an easy walk up to the 2nd floor and then down the hall to the middle of the hotel to our rooms.
reviews.title: over the top service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door to the room. The room was spacious with a king bed, microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, desk, dresser, 2 chairs, 2 nightstands, several lamps and a flat screen tv. Everything, including the carpet, looked updated and very clean. The bathroom had a beautiful large vanity and even a curved shower rod.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Indoor Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know if the health dept. is enforcing laws there, but I believe I got sick from there food, running eggs,b&g my husband did not eat and told me not to and I paid for it all the way home. From now on I will stay somewhere that dose not have food out like that. Do they even have sever permits?
reviews.title: don't eat the food

reviews.text: We stayed in this motel passing through Bend, OR, and it was a great stopover. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the beds very comfortable. The motel was quiet, and the complimentary breakfast had two waffle machines and fresh fruit and great coffee, a step above the usual motels of this caliber.
reviews.title: Best motel in Redmond, OR

reviews.text: For $89/$80 AAA it was a good deal (and we got a discount to $55 which was a super deal). The indoor, wood paneled swimming pool and jacuzzi were really nice and unexpected in this price range.
reviews.title: KIds and a drunk staff

reviews.text: This is definitely the best place to stay in Redmond. Unfortunately, it is also popular, so book early. One night we had to stay at the Sleep Inn, which is second-best.
reviews.title: scary experience

reviews.text: We had a reservation 6 months in advance to use with our Best Western points. During check in they refused to use the points. And wanted payment instead.
reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend any of my staff stay here
